item.description:
BIMM is promoting the TECH DAY CAMP to our members because it's a wonderful chance to LEARN a whole lot in ONE DAY!  They have a fantastic schedule of excellent presenters and topics!

THIS IS A PAID EVENT and you must sign up thru the TECH DAY CAMP REGISTRATION - SIGN UP HERE!  (Signing up on the meetup site will not work)

***********************************************************************

Tech Day Camp is a ONE DAY EVENT for those who want to learn and understand more about technology and how to make it work in their lives. At Tech Day Camp, no question is “too silly”, and there will be plenty of opportunities to ask. A minimum of 6 different workshops will be offered each hour, with a couple of breaks to network, ask questions and get refreshed. The Tech Day Help Center will be staffed throughout the day by our speakers and other technology pros. Tech Day Camp would not be complete without fabulous and fun raffles, prizes and an “afterhours” party.

Who should attend?

Technology beginners, intermediates, and even those who think they know it all. . .the dad, the mom, the grandmother, the business person. . .anyone who would like to better use technology to make lives easier and cooler.

What you will find:

The ‘how to’ and why on: Facebook, Twitter, Google, blogging, photo enhancing, “the cloud”, QuickBooks, the web, WordPress, video, the iPad, basic computer classes, self-publishing, and so much more. Create your own path through the day choosing workshops to fit your needs including some especially designed for business owners, entrepreneurs and non-profit organizations. You can bring your laptop, your iPad, smartphone, or other electronic gadgets and learn how to maximize their use. Or just bring yourself and an interest in learning.

THIS IS A PAID EVENT and you must sign up thru the TECH DAY CAMP REGISTRATION - SIGN UP HERE!  (Signing up on the meetup site will not work)

Schedule for the day:

8:15 AM Registration Opens

8:30 coffee on 3rd floor

9:00 Kick off Keynote

9:30-10:30 Session 1

10:45-11:45 Session 2

12n-1:00pm LUNCH and discussion groups in some rooms

1:00-2:00pm Session 3

2:15-3:15 Session 4

3:30-4:30 Session 5

4:45-5:00 Closing remarks – Raffle

6:30-10p After Party

Here are some of the scheduled presentations:

Location Based Technology for Business and Personal Use with Eric Andersen

Spreading the word: tools that help you get your message out with Bobbie Carlton

10 tips and tricks for the iPad and iPhone with Dave Caolo

Advanced Twitter and Creating a DarWINian Business Model with Leslie Poston

Quickbooks for beginners and Quickbooks tips & tricks with Alison Edmands

Intro to the Cloud and Online Networking Etiquette with Diane Darling

All things Apple with Ed Justen Leveraging social media for your business with Diane Danielson

Facebook for NPO’s, and On-Line Fundraising with John Haydon

WordPress with James Coletti and Kurt Ng

Is social media the silver bullet for nonprofit fundraising with Marc Pitman

Computer Security with Michael Hertz

Making a brochure with word and web design with Shea Baker

Beginning video, and video for the web with Skip Bensley

Blogging with Jeff Cutler

Tips & Techniques using Microsoft Word & Excel with Deb Kane

How Google can work for you with Tricia White

Beginning Social Media with Christina Inge

And More!!!

************************************************************************

THIS IS A PAID EVENT and you must sign up thru the TECH DAY CAMP REGISTRATION - SIGN UP HERE!  (Signing up on the meetup site will not work)
item.name: Tech Day Camp & BIMM - Join us for a cool learning event!
